Incident Description: Users unable to log into Salesforce.
Debugging Steps: 1. Verify SSO configuration. 2. Check Salesforce service status. 3. Reset affected user credentials. 4. Clear browser cache & reattempt login.
Resolution: Reset SSO authentication and confirmed access.
Communication Log: Customer: Unable to log into Salesforce. Support: SSO reset, please try again.

Incident Description: Vendor portal down; users receive 504 Gateway Timeout.
Debugging Steps: 1. Check web server health. 2. Verify API connectivity. 3. Restart backend services. 4. Check DNS resolution.
Resolution: Restarted backend servers, resolving connectivity.
Communication Log: Vendor: Portal is down. Support: Restarted servers, please test.

Incident Description: Users can't access cloud files; sync failures reported.
Debugging Steps: 1. Check cloud provider status. 2. Validate user authentication. 3. Test API response times. 4. Restart storage sync services.
Resolution: Confirmed provider outage; escalated to vendor.
Communication Log: Customer: Cloud storage down. Support: Issue at provider, awaiting fix.

Incident Description: New application release rollback needed due to crashes.
Debugging Steps: 1. Check deployment logs. 2. Rollback latest deployment. 3. Verify rollback success. 4. Investigate root cause.
Resolution: Rolled back failed deployment and restored stable version.
Communication Log: Customer: App update broken. Support: Rolled back, stable version restored.

Incident Description: Scheduled ERP reports fail with timeout error.
Debugging Steps: 1. Analyze SQL execution plan. 2. Check database load. 3. Optimize long-running queries. 4. Increase server resources if needed.
Resolution: Indexing queries resolved timeout issue.
Communication Log: Customer: ERP reports fail. Support: Optimized queries, please retry.

Incident Description: Users unable to connect via VPN after policy update.
Debugging Steps: 1. Review firewall policy changes. 2. Verify VPN logs. 3. Restore previous policy if needed. 4. Communicate to affected users.
Resolution: Reverted firewall rules and restored VPN access.
Communication Log: Customer: VPN not working. Support: Policy fixed, retry now.

Incident Description: Automated CRM workflows not triggering.
Debugging Steps: 1. Check scheduled job logs. 2. Restart workflow services. 3. Debug affected automation rules. 4. Re-test workflow execution.
Resolution: Restarted automation services, resolving issue.
Communication Log: Customer: CRM automation not running. Support: Restarted services, verify now.

Incident Description: Office printers not responding across locations.
Debugging Steps: 1. Check print server status. 2. Restart affected printers. 3. Verify network connectivity. 4. Apply firmware updates if required.
Resolution: Restarted print servers, restoring connectivity.
Communication Log: Customer: Office printers offline. Support: Servers restarted, try printing.

Incident Description: Daily backups failing with authentication errors.
Debugging Steps: 1. Validate backup service credentials. 2. Check cloud provider API health. 3. Verify storage availability. 4. Retry failed backups.
Resolution: Escalated to vendor; awaiting response.
Communication Log: Customer: Backup failed. Support: Issue escalated to cloud provider.

Incident Description: Internet browsing blocked due to proxy failure.
Debugging Steps: Check proxy logs.

Incident Description: Users getting disconnected frequently from Citrix VDI.
Debugging Steps: Analyze Citrix session logs.

Incident Description: Monthly payroll run failing due to DB locks.
Debugging Steps: Investigate database lock contention.

Incident Description: Employees unable to complete MFA login.
Debugging Steps: Check MFA provider status.

Incident Description: ITSM platform unresponsive during peak hours.
Debugging Steps: Monitor ITSM server load.

Incident Description: Factory sensors reporting inconsistent temperature data.
Debugging Steps: Verify sensor calibration.

Incident Description: Third-party API webhooks failing intermittently.
Debugging Steps: Check webhook event logs.

Incident Description: Security patch introduced OS instability.
Debugging Steps: Review patch impact analysis.

Incident Description: Departmental SharePoint pages timing out.
Debugging Steps: Verify SharePoint service health.

Incident Description: Virtual machines not scaling under load.
Debugging Steps: Check cloud auto-scaling logs.

Incident Description: Endpoint security flagged suspicious encryption activity.
Debugging Steps: Isolate infected endpoints.

Incident Description: Reports running slow due to long-running queries.
Debugging Steps: Analyze SQL execution plan.

Incident Description: Users can't connect to Windows RDP servers.
Debugging Steps: Check Windows RDP logs.

Incident Description: Auto-forwarding rules failing for specific domains.
Debugging Steps: Validate email filtering rules.

Incident Description: Message alerts taking too long to deliver.
Debugging Steps: Check webhook delivery logs.

Incident Description: Database service is unreachable.
Debugging Steps: 1. Check server logs for DB errors. 2. Verify network connectivity to DB. 3. Check storage availability and replication lag. 4. Restart database service if necessary.
First Debugging Step: Check server logs for DB errors.
Resolution: Restarted DB services and confirmed successful queries.
Communication Log: Customer: DB is down. Support: Restarted DB services, verify now.

Incident Description: Slow network performance during peak hours.
Debugging Steps: 1. Analyze network traffic patterns. 2. Check switch/router logs. 3. Identify congested nodes. 4. Apply QoS policies to prioritize critical traffic.
Resolution: Applied QoS policies to prioritize critical traffic.
Communication Log: Customer: Network is slow. Support: Running diagnostics.

Incident Description: Unable to send emails; messages stuck in queue.
Debugging Steps: 1. Review SMTP logs for errors. 2. Check email queues for backlogs. 3. Verify DNS & MX records. 4. Restart mail services if necessary.
Resolution: Restarted mail services and verified outgoing email flow.
Communication Log: Customer: Can’t send emails. Support: Restarted mail services. Test now.

Incident Description: Users unable to log in due to authentication errors.
Debugging Steps: 1. Verify SSO authentication logs. 2. Check AD synchronization status. 3. Reset authentication settings. 4. Clear session caches and restart authentication service.
Resolution: Cleared session caches and updated expired certificates.
Communication Log: Customer: CRM login issue. Support: Reset authentication, try now.

Incident Description: Application server showing 95% CPU usage.
Debugging Steps: 1. Monitor CPU & memory usage. 2. Identify resource-heavy processes. 3. Restart non-essential background tasks. 4. Optimize resource allocation.
Resolution: Restarted services and optimized resource allocation.
Communication Log: Customer: App server is slow. Support: Investigating CPU usage.

Incident Description: API requests are intermittently failing.
Debugging Steps: 1. Check API gateway logs. 2. Verify backend server health. 3. Monitor API latency & errors. 4. Scale up API nodes and implement request retries.
Resolution: Scaled up API nodes and implemented request retries.
Communication Log: Customer: API calls are failing. Support: Reviewing logs, will update.

Incident Description: Multiple failed login attempts detected.
Debugging Steps: 1. Investigate security logs. 2. Identify suspicious IPs. 3. Block unauthorized access. 4. Enforce MFA.
Resolution: Enforced MFA and notified the security team.
Communication Log: Customer: Unusual login attempts. Support: Blocked source, enabled MFA.

Incident Description: Users unable to connect to corporate VPN.
Debugging Steps: 1. Verify VPN gateway logs. 2. Check firewall rules for VPN traffic. 3. Restart VPN services. 4. Re-authenticate users.
Resolution: Re-authenticated users and confirmed stable connection.
Communication Log: Customer: VPN not working. Support: Restarted VPN gateway, try now.

Incident Description: Shared network drive inaccessible.
Debugging Steps: 1. Restart file server. 2. Verify storage mount points. 3. Check event logs for disk failures. 4. Restore NTFS & SMB permissions if needed.
Resolution: Restored NTFS & SMB permissions, ran a file system consistency check.
Communication Log: Customer: Can’t access shared drive. Support: Restarted, should work now.

Incident Description: Internal web application frequently crashes.
Debugging Steps: 1. Check application logs for error stack traces. 2. Debug recent deployments. 3. Roll back unstable update. 4. Restart application server.
First Debugging Step: Check application logs for error stack traces.
Resolution: Restarted app & monitored logs for stability.
Communication Log: Customer: App crashes randomly. Support: Checking logs, will update.

Incident Description: Users blocked from accessing external services.
Debugging Steps: 1. Review firewall logs. 2. Identify blocked traffic.
Resolution: Applied policy updates and restarted firewall services.
Communication Log: Customer: Can’t access external apps. Support: Firewall rules updated.
